bioghist.p: The educational work of Villanova University is under the direction of the Vice President for Academic Affairs. The various undergraduate colleges of the University--Liberal Arts and Sciences, Engineering, Business, and Nursing--as well as the Division of Part-Time and Continuing Studies and Falvey Memorial Library--are supervised by the deans and directors who report directly to the Vice President for Academic Affairs. The Office of Research and Sponsored Projects (ORSP) serves and assists research investigators in seeking the necessary resources and in managing their use in accordance with the objectives of the University and of external sponsors.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of Villanova's Vice President for Academic Affairs and the Office of Research and Special Projects. The records consist of administrative files, correspondence, minutes, legal records, and reports. Administrative records include Board of Trustees Academic Affairs Committee and Faculty Affairs Committee records (1975-1987); policies on salaries, rank and tenure, sabbaticals, faculty dismissal and suspension, and evaluations; grant manuals; and policy manuals for research on human subjects. Correspondence (1947-2002) covers a range of topics related to academic affairs, such as tenure and rank matters, programs and departments, appointments and hiring searches. Legal records include an Asbestos Materials Survey, information on the Cooperative Education Program, and information on a patent for a Hepatitis test (1971). Minutes are present for the Board of Trustees Academic Affairs Committee (1980-1989); the Rank and Tenure Committee (1968-1984); the University Senate (Rank and Tenure and Faculty Affairs Committees) (1976-1988); the Faculty Affairs Committee (1963-1974); the College of Commerce and Finance (1990-1995); and several other committees. Reports make up the largest portion of this collection, and include tenure and promotion reports for individual faculty members; reports of the Rank and Tenure Committee; annual reports of the ORSP (1949-1951 and 1983-1992); and reports from several other University departments and committees.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
